Component: Menus - Side Scroller

Introduction

When on a mobile viewport size, display a menu in a horizontal fashion but allow for scrolling left/right as there may be a large number of items within the scrolling section.

This side-scrolling menu has an optional arrow that can be displayed by adding a DOM element to the bottom of the <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items"> element.

This optional arrow has the following rules:

  • When at the left-most position (where the nav starts, there should be an arrow on the right with a gradient behind it
  • When the user moves the nav at all, the arrow disappears
  • The arrow reappears when the user moves the nav back to the starting position
  • If the user refreshes the page, the nav moves back to the left most position and the arrow should be there

Sidescroll Default

This is the complete package. What you see here is exactly the implementation that exists on tesla.com

  1. Link 1
  2. Link 2
  3. Link 3
  4. Link 4
  5. Link 5
  6. Link 6
  7. Link 7
  8. Link 8
  9. Link 9
  10. Link 10
  11. Link 11
  12. Link 12
  13. Link 13
▲ 
<div style="max-width: 380px;width: 100%;">
  <nav class="tsla-sidescroll-menu" data-tsla_showsidescroll_arrow="true">
    <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item tsla-sidescroll-menu--item_selected">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 1</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 2</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 3</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 4</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 5</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 6</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 7</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 8</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 9</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 10</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 11</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 12</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 13</a>
      </li>
    </ol>
    <i class="tsla-sidescroll-arrow tsla-icon-angle_right"></i>
  </nav>
</div>

Sidescroll With Arrow

Side scroll without the disappearing arrow. This hide/show interaction is added by the data-tsla_showsidescroll_arrow="true" to the element's root (tsla-sidescroll-menu).

Sidescroll Without Arrow

Side scroll without arrow. If you don't want the arrow at all, simply remove the following DOM element: <i class="tsla-sidescroll-arrow tsla-icon-angle_right"></i>

Sidescroll on top of an image

You might find yourself in a situation where you need to add the side scroller on top of an image. If this ever happens to you, you can accommodate this by adding .tsla-sidescroll-menu--over_image to the root element, .tsla-sidescroll-menu. This will make the component position: absolute; and change the background-color to 50% transparent, allowing some of the image behind to blend through. Example below.

  1. Link 1
  2. Link 2
  3. Link 3
  4. Link 4
  5. Link 5
  6. Link 6
  7. Link 7
  8. Link 8
  9. Link 9
  10. Link 10
  11. Link 11
  12. Link 12
  13. Link 13
▲ 
<div style="width: 380px;">
  <nav class="tsla-sidescroll-menu tsla-sidescroll-menu--over_image" data-tsla_showsidescroll_arrow="true">
    <ol class="tsla-nav--list_items">
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item tsla-nav--item_selected">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 1</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 2</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 3</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 4</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 5</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 6</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 7</a>

      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 8</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
        <a href="#" target="_blank" title="" class="tsla-nav--list_link">Link 9</a>
      </li>
      <li class="tsla-nav--list_item">
